Adds clusters' ids to a lsp object

Source: R/lsp_add_clusters.R
lsp_add_clusters.Rd

Adds clusters' ids to a lsp object. The output can be of stars or sf class. See examples.

lsp_add_clusters(x, clust, output = "sf", window = NULL)

Arguments

x

Object of class lsp - usually the output of the lsp_signature() function
clust

Vector containing an id value for each row in x
output

The class of the output. Either "stars" or "sf"
window

Specifies areas for analysis. It can be either: NULL or an sf object. If window=NULL calculations are performed based on the metadata from x. If an sf object is provided, each feature (row) defines the extent of a local pattern. The sf object should have one attribute (otherwise, the first attribute is used as an id).

Examples

library(stars)
#> Loading required package: abind
#> Loading required package: sf
#> Linking to GEOS 3.8.1, GDAL 2.4.4, PROJ 7.0.1
landform = read_stars(system.file("raster/landform.tif", package = "motif"))
landform_cove = lsp_signature(landform,
                               type = "cove",
                               window = 200,
                               normalization = "pdf")

landform_dist = lsp_to_dist(landform_cove,
                            dist_fun = "jensen-shannon")
#> Metric: 'jensen-shannon' using unit: 'log2'; comparing: 290 vectors.

landform_hclust = hclust(landform_dist, method = "ward.D2")
plot(landform_hclust)

clusters = cutree(landform_hclust, k = 6)

safe_pal = c("#88CCEE", "#CC6677", "#DDCC77",
             "#117733", "#332288", "#888888")

landform_grid_stars = lsp_add_clusters(landform_cove, clusters)
plot(landform_grid_stars["clust"], col = safe_pal)
#> Warning: col is not of length 1 or nrow(x): colors will be recycled; use pal to specify a color palette

landform_grid_starsq = lsp_add_quality(landform_grid_stars,
                                       landform_dist)
plot(landform_grid_starsq["quality"])
